analyzed: mi rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: yang dge slong gang mi 'am mir chags pa la bsams bzhin du rang gis lag dar te srog bcad dam de la mtshon byin nam /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang mi 'am mir chags pa la bsams bzhin du rang gis lag dar te srog bcad dam de la mtshon byin nam /

analyzed: de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam de @259b 'chir bcug gam de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod kyang rung ste /

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kye mi khyod 'tsho ba sdig pa mi gtsang ba ngan pa 'dis ci zhig bya /

analyzed: kye mi khyod gson pa bas shi bla'i zhes zer zhing sems kyi 'dod pa dang sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag gis rnam grangs du mas de 'chir bcug gam de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod de /

analyzed: de yang rtsom pa de dus byas nas dge slong de yang pham par gyur pa yin gyi gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is stated in the PrƒÅtimok·π£a S≈´tra.

analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: mi 'am zhes bya ba ni gang gi ma'i ltor dbang po drug po 'di lta ste mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po thob par gyur pa'o // mir chags pa la zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma'i ltor dbang po gsum po 'di lta ste /

analyzed: lus dang / srog dang / yid kyi dbang po thob par gyur pa la'o //

analyzed: bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags nas so //

analyzed: rang gis lag dar te zhes pa ni lag pas lag pa dar te'o //

original: srog bcad dam zhes bya ba ni de'i srog bcad par gyur na'o //üîΩde la mtshon byin nam zhes bya ba ni ral gri 'am /
analyzed: srog bcad dam zhes bya ba ni de'i srog bcad par gyur na'o // de la mtshon byin nam zhes bya ba ni ral gri 'am /

analyzed: de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'am bud med dam /üîΩma ning ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEncourages another to kill‚Äù means to request a man, woman, or neuter person to kill.üîΩ‚ÄúApproves of killing‚Äù means to rejoice in the killing.

original: de 'chir bcug gam zhes bya ba ni 'chir gzhug pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: de gsum la lhung bzed la sogs pa thob tu re bas 'chir bcug ste shi na pham par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de 'chir bcug nas dge slong 'gyod pa skyes te /

analyzed: de ltar na yang sbyor ba snga ma de nyid kyis nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir bzlog kyang ma btub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog kyang ma btub ste /
translated: If, despite his efforts to stop him, the other does not die,

original: shi na yang sbyor ba snga ma de nyid kyis nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi na yang sbyor ba snga ma de nyid kyis nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is a serious violation due to the previous action.

original: de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni 'chi bar mngon par mi dga' ba'i mdun du 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa'o //üîΩde la 'di skad ces kye mi khyod ces bya ba ni bod @260a * //

original: pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
analyzed: pa'i tshig bla dgas so //

original: 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni gson pa'o //

analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'am sdig pa'i rgyu'o //

analyzed: mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gzhi mi gtsang ba'o //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúor praises death in his presence‚Äù is added to indicate that one praises death in many ways in the presence of someone who does not wish to die.

analyzed: dus byas nas zhes bya ba ni shi na'o //

analyzed: dge slong de yang pham par 'gyur ba yin gyi gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: med bzhin du 'di shes so //
analyzed: med bzhin du 'di shes so //

analyzed: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te /
translated: I did not see it when I said I saw it;

original: gsob gsog brdzun du smras so zhes zer na mngon pa'i nga rgyal ma gtogs te dge slong de yang pham par gyur pa yin gyi gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa yin te /

translated: If he says, ‚ÄúI lied, I spoke falsely, I spoke nonsense,‚Äù then, except for manifest pride, that monk too has become one with a root downfall and should not be allowed to stay.

analyzed: de yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As for ‚Äúmonk,‚Äù it is as above.

translated: As for ‚Äúdoes not know,‚Äù he does not know form by means of a contaminated cognition of the levels of meditative concentration and the formless realm, and he does not know feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: yongs su mi shes la zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i shes pa zag pa med pa'i gzugs yongs su mi shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang yongs su mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes la zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i shes pa zag pa med pa'i gzugs yongs su mi shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang yongs su mi shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot fully understanding‚Äù means not fully understanding the form of the uncontaminated knowledge of the levels of meditative concentration and the formless realm, and not fully understanding feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma zhes bya ba la mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHigher than human‚Äù means that the human dharma is nirvana.

original: de ni rnams kyis 'thob kyi za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dag gis kyang mi 'thob na /
analyzed: de ni rnams kyis 'thob kyi za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dag gis kyang mi 'thob na /
translated: It is obtained by humans, but not by eunuchs, hermaphrodites, or those with two sexual organs.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yid dags rnams kyis lta smos kyang rtsi dgos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbla ma zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams pas gzugs kyi khams bla ma yin la /

translated: If it is not even obtained by animals, hungry ghosts, or hell beings, what need is there to mention those who are human?üîΩ‚ÄúHigher‚Äù means that the form realm is higher than the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams pas gzugs med pa'i khams bla ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams pas gzugs med pa'i khams bla ma yin pa'o //

original: yang na mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang / the tshom dag go //
analyzed: yang na mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang / the tshom dag go //
translated: Or else, the human dharma is the five hindrances: sensual desire, malice, torpor and sleep, restlessness and worry, and doubt.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni de dag spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni de dag spangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The superior dharma is the abandonment of those.

original: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /

original: mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bye grag thob pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa thob pa ste /

analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams yin no //

analyzed: bye brag thob pa zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi po dag ste /
translated: The attainment of distinction is the four fruits of the sramana:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ongs ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa yid do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ongs ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa yid do //

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa bzhi po dag ste /

original: rjes su mi tshol ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: rjes su mi tshol ba'i shes rab bo //

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba bzhi po dag ste /

original: sdug bsngal mthong ba dang / kun 'byung ba mthong ba dang / 'gog pa mthong ba dang / lam mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong ba dang / kun 'byung ba mthong ba dang / 'gog pa mthong ba dang / lam mthong ba ste /
translated: the seeing of suffering, the seeing of the origin of suffering, the seeing of the cessation of suffering, and the seeing of the path.üîΩIt is the wisdom that seeks.

original: rjes su tshol pa'i shes rab bo reg par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag la bde par @261a * //üîΩgnas pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su tshol pa'i shes rab bo reg par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag la bde par @261a * // gnas pa ste /
translated: The enjoyment of the formless is the four formless concentrations, the abode of bliss.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa las yin gyi /
translated: It is from entering them,

original: skye ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: not from being born there.

original: med pa la zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa la zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Nonexistent means non-existent things.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa 'am mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa 'am mi srid pa'o //
translated: They are not directly perceived or impossible.

original: med bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la med bzhin du ste /
analyzed: med bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la med bzhin du ste /
translated: As if non-existent means as if one does not have them oneself.

original: ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'o //
translated: It is not obtaining them.

original: 'di shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di shes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement one knows this,

original: ji zhig shes so zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig shes so zhe na /
translated: What does one know?

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam shes so zhes so //üîΩ'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du @274a * //

analyzed: shes rab ces smos pas ni zag pa med pa'i lam bzung ngo //

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la slob tu 'jug nus pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la slob tu 'jug nus pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slob tu 'jug nus pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa brgyad pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni snga ma nyid kyi bye brag yin par rig par bya ste /

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / lhag pa'i spyod pa la slob pa dang / lhag pa'i 'dul ba la slob ba dang / lhag pa'i so sor thar pa la slob pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / lhag pa'i spyod pa la slob pa dang / lhag pa'i 'dul ba la slob ba dang / lhag pa'i so sor thar pa la slob pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa dgu pa'o //

original: rtag tu lhag par spyad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhag pa'i 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i bslab pa'i rnam par bshad par gyur pa rnam par 'byed pa dang gzhi dang phran tshegs la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: lhag pa'i so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar par gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams so //

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / lhag pa'i spyod pa la slob tu 'jug nus pa @274b dang ; lhag pa'i 'dul ba la slob tu 'jug nus pa dang / lhag pa'i so sor thar pa la slob tu 'jug nus pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa bcu pa'o //

translated: The fifth is the ability to cause others to train in the higher morality, the higher thought, and the higher action.

analyzed: slob tu 'jug nus pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan lhag pa'i spyod pa la sogs pa la slob tu 'jug nus pa nyid do //

original: dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / thos pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa bcu gcig pa'o //

analyzed: de la dad pa zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa dag la sems dang ba'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa spong ba'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni 'dir 'dul ba bzung ba yin te /

analyzed: gtong ba zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //

analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa dang mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba shes pa dang mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of liberation, and the perfection of the knowledge and insight of liberation.

analyzed: 'dir yang tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa zhes smos pas ni 'dul ba mngon par shes pa nyid ston to //

analyzed: ste / rnam par grol ba shes pa ni zas pa dang mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de mthong ba ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o //

analyzed: nang du yang dag gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dben par gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Possessed of morality, possessing much learning, one who has begun effort, one who is possessed of wisdom, and one who is well-equipoised are the fifteenth of the five.

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mi rgod pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: slob pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i slob pa'i ngang tshul can te /

translated: The aggregate of concentration of a learner is the uncontaminated concentration of a learner that arises in the mindstream of the seven types of ƒÅrya beings.

analyzed: slob pa'i shes rab kyi phung po zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi rgyud las byung ba slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The aggregate of learning wisdom is the uncontaminated right view of a learner that arises in the mindstream of an ƒÅrya person.

analyzed: slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni slob pa yid la byed pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa slob pa'i mos pa'o //

original: slob pa'i chos shes pa la sogs pa ni shes pa //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos shes pa la sogs pa ni shes pa //

original: ba 'khor gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: In a monastery where there are only ten or more fully ordained monks who do not possess any of the five [seniority] factors, and where there is no one senior to them who possesses the five [seniority] factors, in order to show how they should proceed, the venerable Upali asked the Blessed Buddha, the World-Honored One, World-Honored One, if there are only ten or more fully ordained monks who do not possess any of the five [seniority] factors, and where there is no one senior to them who possesses the five [seniority] factors, how should they proceed?

analyzed: de la ji skad ces bgyi zhes bya ba ni tha snyad ji skad ces brjod bar bgyi zhes bya ba'o //

original: gnas brtan byis pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'i phyir gnas brtan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas brtan byis pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'i phyir gnas brtan zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'dul ba mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir byis pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: ches rgan ba med na ches gzhon pa la gnas pas 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te rgan pa lnga pa gang yang rung ba gcig dang yang mi ldan par gyur na de'i cho ga ni de yin no //

original: ches rgan pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ches rgan pa zhes bya ba ni lnga pa dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: ches @277b gzhon pa zhes bya ba ni lo grangs kyis gzhon pa la bya'i lnga pa dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /

original: des lo bcu lon pa lnga pa dang ldan pa nyid bzung ngo //
analyzed: des lo bcu lon pa lnga pa dang ldan pa nyid bzung ngo //

analyzed: ci nye gnas kyi tshul khrims thams cad bya'am zhes na / de'i phyir thams cad bya ste /

analyzed: 'dud pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: rgan pas gzhon pa la btud de phyag bya ba la 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gnas pa'i tshul khrims de las gzhan pa dag la rjes su gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: dge slong gnas na gnas pas ji ltar rjes su gnas pa bstan na /

analyzed: lam du zhugs pas kyang ci de dag nyid la rjes su gnas par bya ba 'am zhe na ma yin te /

analyzed: myur du ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag 'di na 'khod na bdag cag yul gzhan du 'khod du mi rung bas myur du phyir ldog dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúQuickly return‚Äù means that if the preceptor and master are staying here, it is not suitable for us to stay in another country, so we must quickly return.

analyzed: skyen par ldog dgos pa zhes bya ba ni bdag cag mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la byams pas lam nas ldog pa'i tshe yang brtan par ldog dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúReturn quickly‚Äù means that when we return from the road out of love for the preceptor and master, we must return firmly.

analyzed: btsal bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi slob dpon btsal bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'khor nyung shas cig ces bya ba ni 'khor nyung ngu zhig go //

analyzed: sku thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du gus par mdzad pa'i bya bas 'gyur bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: g-yas nas zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //

original: glang po che'i lta stangs kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i tshigs klu ltar 'brel pa'i phyir glang po che'i gtso bo bzhin du sku thams cad kyis g-yas nas snam logs su bskor te rnam par gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i lta stangs kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i tshigs klu ltar 'brel pa'i phyir glang po che'i gtso bo bzhin du sku thams cad kyis g-yas nas snam logs su bskor te rnam par gzigs pa'o //
translated: With the gaze of an elephant means that he looks over his right shoulder with his whole body, like the chief of elephants, because the Tathagata's body is connected like the coils of a snake.

original: ci'i phyir med par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he do this?

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mkhyen pa kho na yin mod @278a * //
analyzed: mkhyen pa kho na yin mod @278a * //

analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi phyir rmed par mdzad kyi mi mkhyen pa'i phyir rmed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa zhes bya ba ni gal te mkhyen na ci'i phyir rmed par mdzad ce na ;
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa zhes bya ba ni gal te mkhyen na ci'i phyir rmed par mdzad ce na ;
translated: If they know, why do they ask?

original: skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to refute denigration.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong nyes pa dang phan yon mi shes pa de dag la ma rmas par bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa'am gnang bar gyur na dge slong de dag bcom ldan 'das la 'di la su legs pa'am nyes pa ci byas na bcom ldan
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong nyes pa dang phan yon mi shes pa de dag la ma rmas par bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa'am gnang bar gyur na dge slong de dag bcom ldan 'das la 'di la su legs pa'am nyes pa ci byas na bcom ldan
translated: If the Blessed One had not questioned those monks who did not know the faults and benefits, and had established or permitted a precept, those monks would have slandered the Blessed One, saying, ‚ÄúWho has done well or badly in this?

original: 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba'am /
analyzed: 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba'am /

analyzed: gnang ba mdzad ces skur pa 'debs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, he questioned them while knowing.

original: mkhyen kyang mi rmed pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzhan gyi don ma gzigs na mkhyen kyang mi rmed pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen kyang mi rmed pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzhan gyi don ma gzigs na mkhyen kyang mi rmed pa ste /

original: gdul ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdus su rmed pa zhes bya ba ni bya bas g-yen spyo ba med pa dag dang / ma 'dres pa'i dus su rmed par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro // dus su rmed pa zhes bya ba ni bya bas g-yen spyo ba med pa dag dang / ma 'dres pa'i dus su rmed par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Because there is no one to be disciplined.üîΩ‚ÄúHe questions at the right time‚Äù means he questions without interrupting activities and at an appropriate time.

original: dus las yol bar mi rmed par zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa'i dus su mi rmed pa ste /
analyzed: dus las yol bar mi rmed par zhes bya ba ni snga ma las bzlog pa'i dus su mi rmed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not question when the time has passed‚Äù means he does not question at a time contrary to the above.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no purpose.

original: don dang ldan pa rmed pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa rmed par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa rmed pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong bar bya ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa dang ldan pa rmed par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who asks about what is meaningful is the one who asks about the purpose of seeing the truths, etc.

original: don dang mi ldan pa mi rmed pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan pa mi rmed pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir te /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi shes bya byang chub shing gi rim pa snyed thugs su chud kyang rim pa gcig tsam las bka' ma stsal to zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //

translated: For, although the Lord Buddha has understood all objects of knowledge, which are as vast as the ocean, he has not spoken about them except in brief.

original: chu lon gyis ldog par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni chu lon lta bus mi mdzad par bzlog par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: chu lon gyis ldog par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni chu lon lta bus mi mdzad par bzlog par mdzad pa ste /

analyzed: thugs rje dang mkhyen pa gnyis kyis rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dus mkhyen pa yin pas zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gal te dus mkhyen pa nyid kyis ci zhig ston par byed ce na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa skra'i rtse mo brgyar gshags pa tsam yang nyams par mi mdzad de /

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dul ba la brten te /üîΩnyin mtshan lan drug rnam par gzigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad @278b kyi 'di ltar bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang 'di la ngas rjes su gnang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su gnang bar bya ba la phyir dgag par bya ba
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'dul ba la brten te / nyin mtshan lan drug rnam par gzigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad @278b kyi 'di ltar bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang 'di la ngas rjes su gnang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su gnang bar bya ba la phyir dgag par bya ba
translated: The Bhagavan always watches over the VinayaüîΩsix times during the day and night.

analyzed: gang yin pa de ni phyir dgag par bya'o snyam du bstan pa la yang rnam par gzigs pa ston to // lo lnga lon pa chos lnga dang ldan pas mi gnas par ljongs rgyur 'gro bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te lo lnga yang lon pa lnga pa nyi shu rtsa gcig sngar bstan pa'i lnga pa tha ma dang yang ldan na gnas ma bcas
translated: He also watches over the teaching, thinking, I will permit what should be permitted and I will prohibit what should be prohibited in order to maintain the teaching.üîΩHe permits those who have completed five years to travel in the country without a preceptor.

analyzed: par yang 'gro zhing rgyu bar bya'o //

analyzed: ci 'dir lo lnga lon pa nyid gtso bo yin nam /

analyzed: 'on te lnga pa tha ma dang yang ldan pa nyid gtso bo yin zhe na /

translated: Here, both are primary. To teach this, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúVenerable UpƒÅli asked the Lord Buddha,‚Äù and so on.
